skill.name: gen-env
skill.description: Creates, updates, or reviews a project's gen-env command for running multiple isolated instances on localhost. Handles instance identity, port allocation, data isolation, browser state separation, and cleanup.
skill.summary: Creates, updates, or reviews a project's gen-env command for running multiple isolated instances on ...
skill.author: 0xBigBoss

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate development tool for generating isolated local environments. The code generates environment variables, Docker Compose configurations, and manages port allocation. No malicious patterns, network exfiltration, or credential theft capabilities detected.

content.value_statement: Running multiple project instances on localhost causes port conflicts, shared browser state, and data contamination. This skill generates a gen-env command that creates isolated development environments with unique ports, Docker names, and browser-safe subdomains.
actual_capabilities: Generate environment files with unique instance identity
Allocate dynamic ports from ephemeral range 49152-65535
Create Docker Compose project names for data isolation
Persist configuration in lockfile for consistent reuse
Provide cleanup commands for surgical instance removal
limitations: Requires Docker and Docker Compose to be installed
Chrome and Edge automatically resolve *.localhost to 127.0.0.1
Browser isolation only works with subdomain-based hosts
Does not manage remote environments or cloud deployments

use_cases.title: Run multiple feature branches
use_cases.description: Test different branches simultaneously without port conflicts or shared database state

use_cases.title: Parallel API and UI development
use_cases.description: Run backend and frontend services in isolated environments for testing integrations

use_cases.title: CI pipeline isolation
use_cases.description: Generate unique environments for each CI job to prevent parallel test interference

prompt_templates.title: Create gen-env script
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a gen-env script for my project that handles PostgreSQL, Redis, API, and Web services. Use TypeScript with Bun runtime.

prompt_templates.title: Review existing gen-env
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the existing gen-env implementation in this project. Check for proper port isolation, browser cookie separation, and Docker naming conventions.

prompt_templates.title: Add custom ports
prompt_templates.prompt: Add Storybook and Swagger ports to the gen-env configuration. Ensure they use the same isolation patterns as existing services.

prompt_templates.title: Integrate with Tilt
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Tiltfile configuration that reads from the generated .localnet.env file for local development with docker_compose.

output_examples.input: Create a gen-env script for feature branch development
output: To clean up: docker compose -p localnet-feature-x down -v

best_practices: Use subdomain-based hosts (name.localhost) for browser cookie and localStorage isolation
Store generated files in .gitignore to prevent accidental commits
Validate name conflicts between lockfile and requested name before regeneration
anti_patterns: Hardcoding localhost in URLs causes cookie sharing between instances
Missing COMPOSE_PROJECT_NAME leads to Docker resource name collisions
Running docker compose down -v without project name risks destroying wrong data

faq.question: Which browsers support *.localhost resolution?
faq.answer: Chrome and Edge treat *.localhost as 127.0.0.1 automatically. Firefox requires network.dns.upperCaseLookup in about:config.

faq.question: What port range does gen-env use?
faq.answer: Ephemeral ports 49152-65535 to avoid conflicts with well-known services below 49152.

faq.question: How does browser state isolation work?
faq.answer: Different subdomains (main.localhost vs feature-x.localhost) create separate cookie jars in modern browsers.

faq.question: Is generated data safe to commit?
faq.answer: No. Add .localnet.env and .gen-env.lock to .gitignore to prevent leaking port assignments.

faq.question: Can gen-env handle monorepos?
faq.answer: Yes. Each app in the monorepo can have its own gen-env script importing shared port allocation logic.

faq.question: How is this different from docker-compose.override.yml?
faq.answer: gen-env creates complete isolation including ports, volumes, networks, and browser state for multiple simultaneous instances.
